business.headline: GST cut before Diwali? These items likely to cost you less this festive seasonPrime Minister Narendra Modi gave the first indication of GST reforms in his Independence Day address from the Red Fort, calling it a "Diwali Bonanza."

Exclusive: Sunjay Kapur's sister raises concern over treatment of familyMandhira Kapur Smith, sister of late Sona Comstar Chairperson Sunjay Kapur, has raised concerns over her family's treatment by the automotive firm founded by their late father. She said her 80-year-old mother Rani Kapur has been sidelined, claiming the family has been treated "like strangers" and excluded from obituaries and public acknowledgments.

Big GST cuts ahead: Will small cars, insurance get cheaper?The proposal to reduce GST on insurance premiums could make health and life cover more affordable. Industry experts say this would be a welcome change and could help improve insurance penetration across the country.

ITR-6 excel utility now live: Who is eligible to file?The Income Tax Department has rolled out the excel utility for ITR-6 for AY 2025-26. But this form isn't meant for everyone — here's who is required to use it.

Regaal Resources IPO allotment today: Check status, GMP & listing dateInvestors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (previously known as Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).
Maruti Suzuki rallies 8%: Why GST relief is driving auto stocks higherEarly trade clearly showed strong buying in auto and financial stocks, while IT and pharma names dragged at the bottom.

Sensex jumps 1,000 points: Why is stock market rising today?At 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 950.18 points at 81,547.84, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 310 points to 24,941.90. Broader market indices also gained as investors cheered the prospects of a simplified GST regime and an upgrade in India's sovereign credit rating by S&P.
Sensex, Nifty surge as PM hints at GST reforms by Diwali; Maruti jumps 7%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1,062.91 points to 81,659.75, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 356 points to 24,987.30 as of 9:32 am.

Treated like strangers: Sunjay Kapur's sister alleges family sidelined by companyMandhira Kapur Smith alleged that the family has been treated as strangers and everyone's forgotten the legacy, forgotten that her mother's still alive.

Should you let AI analyse your online spending habits?Artificial intelligence is gradually slipping into our wallets. From tracking what we buy to predicting our next expense, AI-based tools are becoming popular. But should you really let AI analyse your online spending habits?

Trade deal talks hit roadblock as US delegation's India visit could be delayedThe India-US trade deal talks face a potential roadblock as the US delegation may delay its August 25 visit to India. This postponement impacts scheduled negotiations that were crucial for preventing additional tariffs. A 50% tariff on Indian goods is set to take effect from August 27. Currently, a 25% tariff is already in place, impacting exporters. The deferment of the meeting does not signify cancellation, but rather a delay. Reasons for the delay could be operational or related to geopolitical outcomes. "A 50% tariff will be imposed on us from August 27 in totality." The BTA deal is anticipated by the end of September or October, with expectations for a meeting by the end of August, contingent on geopolitical developments.

Trade deal in limbo as US team's India visit deferred amid tariff warThe United States has been pressing India to open its agriculture and dairy sectors, but New Delhi has ruled out concessions, saying such moves would endanger small farmers and cattle rearers.

Real wallet-friendly shake-up: GST 2.0 to feel like 'Good and Simple Tax'The government is set to launch GST 2.0 with major rate cuts, making essentials cheaper and simplifying tax slabs. The overhaul promises lower prices, fewer complications, and a true 'Good and Simple Tax'.

What nobody tells you about buying motor insuranceWhile car sales are climbing, many buyers remain unaware about the finer points of motor insurance, a gap that can cost them money and create problems when making a claim.

Government proposes 5%, 18% GST slabs; tobacco at 40%, relief for farmers: SourcesThe government has proposed reducing GST to two slabs: 5% and 18% with sin goods at 40%, aiming to cut taxes on essentials like farm products, health items, handicrafts, and insurance.

Credit ratings decoded: How a simple upgrade can change a country's fortuneGlobal credit rating agency S&P Global has upgraded India's long-term unsolicited sovereign credit rating to 'BBB' from 'BBB-'.

GST council meeting in September, 12% slam may be dropped: SourcesTwo-day GST Council meetings are expected in September to pave the way for reforms. The announcement was made by the Prime Minister from the ramparts of the Red Fort. These reforms are seen as a Diwali gift for the middle class. Key changes include the removal of the 12% GST slab and rate rationalisation for health and life insurance policies. The government aims to reduce the GST on most items currently in the 12% slab to 5%. This move is expected to make essential items such as footwear, bags, clothes, and toothpastes more affordable. The government is addressing concerns about inflation and the rising cost of living. Feedback regarding health insurance, which impacts the common person, has also been considered. The meetings in September are crucial for approving these changes, with implementation anticipated before Diwali. The Finance Ministry and state finance ministers have been involved in the process.

GST Council may drop 12% slab, more tax reforms in September meeting: SourcesThe meeting comes after Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his Independence Day speech, announced plans for a major overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) system.

Claiming bias, same-sex couple approaches court over uneven tax: ReportThe petition was admitted by a bench of Justice BP Colabawalla and Justice Firdoush Pooniwalla, which has also issued a notice to the Attorney General as the case raises a constitutional question.

PM Modi announces next-generation GST reform with significantly lower ratesDuring his Independence Day address, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a sweeping overhaul of the GST system, promising to unveil a "next-generation" tax regime with substantially lower rates this Diwali, which he hailed as a festive gift from the Centre.

Rs 15,000 from government on 1st private-sector job: PM's big youth schemePM Modi in his Independence Day speech said that the Pradhan Mantri Viksit Bharat Rojgar Yojana will create nearly 3.5 crore new employment opportunities for the youth.

GST cut coming soon? What to expect after PM Modi's big Diwali promisePrime Minister Narendra Modi's announcement has set expectations for a substantial overhaul of the current multi-slab GST structure, which has been in place since 2017.

5 IPOs to open for bidding next week: Which is best based on GMP?Next week will see the IPOs of Patel Retail, Vikram Solar, Gem Aromatics, Shreeji Shipping Global and Mangal Electrical. Together, they are looking to raise Rs 3,584.09 crore from the market.

Why your 45-day credit card grace period might be a debt trap, explains CAMany believe a credit card's 45-day grace period means free borrowing time. But as an expert explains, even a small unpaid balance can turn it into a costly debt trap.

Sensex, Nifty end marginally higher as investors await Trump-Putin meet outcomeThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 57.75 points to end at 80,597.66, while the NSE Nifty50 added just 11.95 points to close at 24,631.30.

S&P upgrades India's sovereign rating to 'BBB' on growth, fiscal disciplineThe move comes more than a year after S&P revised India's outlook to positive from stable in May 2024, on the back of robust growth and improved expenditure quality. The rating agency also revised India's transfer and convertibility assessment to 'A-' from 'BBB+'.

Fresh scrutiny on FedEx, UPS, DHL top brass in antitrust case: ReportExecutives set to be questioned include Subhasish Chakraborty, Managing Director of DTDC Express; R.S. Subramanian, Managing Director of DHL Express India, and more.

7 major income tax changes in 2025 that will impact your money2025 has brought a wave of changes to India's income tax rules, from bigger exemptions to extended filing deadlines. Here's a simple breakdown of the seven key updates that could directly affect your finances.

Cognizant to roll out wage hikes for 80% of eligible employees. Details hereIT giant Cognizant is set to give salary hikes to 80% of eligible employees from November 1, with top performers in India receiving high single-digit increases.

JSW Cement shares fall after listing at 4% premium: Should you hold or sell?JSW Cement's share price listed at 4% above its issue price of Rs 147. On the BSE, the stock opened at Rs 153, up 4.1%, while on the NSE it debuted at Rs 153.50, a gain of 4.4%.

Man invested Rs 18,000/month for 4 years, earned less than FDs. CA explains whyThe investor believed he was on the right track. His funds showed a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 11%. But when he calculated his portfolio XIRR—the actual return on his money—it was just 6%. That's less than the 7% a fixed deposit would have paid over the same period.
Pakistan's credit rating gets a lift from Moody's. Here's whyS&P Global Ratings raised Pakistan's rating to B- from CCC+ on July 24, while Fitch Ratings did the same in April.

RBI's new rule: Cheques to clear in just hours starting this dateUnder the new rule, cheques will be scanned, presented, and cleared continuously during business hours, reducing the clearing cycle from the current T+1 days to just a few hours.

ICICI Bank cuts minimum balance after backlash. Check new rules and penaltiesThe bank's decision comes after strong public criticism, particularly over the earlier increase in urban and metro monthly average balance levels.
JSW Cement shares list at 4% premium on stock market debut On the BSE, the shares opened at Rs 153, up 4.1%, while on the NSE they began trading at Rs 153.50, a gain of 4.4%.

Muthoot Finance shares jump 10% to hit record high after Q1 results. Should you buy?The gold loan financing company has seen its stock lifted by strong quarterly performance, rising investor confidence, and positive brokerage recommendations. entertainment.headline: Amitabh Bachchan praises S Jaishankar on KBC Independence Day special episodeOn the 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' Independence Day special, Amitabh Bachchan praised External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, comparing his strong diplomatic style to that of an Army officer. Singer Kanika Kapoor says singers earn just Rs 101 for songs in IndiaPopular singer Kanika Kapoor has opened up about the financial hardships faced by vocalists in the Indian music industry. She revealed that many singers receive minimal payments and rely mainly on live shows for income.

general news.headline: Exclusive: As Op Sindoor peaked, Pak Navy took a backseat, satellite imagery showsNew commercial satellite imagery analysed by India Today's OSINT team shows Pak Navy warships dispersed to commercial docks while others took refuge at its western port of Gwadar, close to the Iranian border.

Putin's bodyguards carried 'poop suitcase' to Alaska meet with Trump: ReportMembers of the Russian President's Federal Protection Service (FPS) collect Russian President Vladimir Putin's waste, including his poop, store it in special bags and bring it back to Moscow in dedicated suitcases, a report by The Express US, which cited investigative journalists Mikhail Rubin and Regis Gente in French publication Paris Match, said.

Babar and Rizwan aren't Pakistan's key players; they don't win matches: HafeezFormer Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez has criticised Mohammad Rizwan and Babar Azam for not being the key players for their team due to their inability to help them win big matches in recent times.

East Bengal take 2-1 win vs Mohun Bagan, Diamantakos' brace seals derby winEast Bengal beat Mohun Bagan 2-1 in a fiery Kolkata Derby to reach the Durand Cup quarterfinals. Dimitrios Diamantakos scored twice, while Anirudh Thapa netted for the Mariners, but East Bengal's resilience sealed a morale-boosting early-season win.

Watch: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma share moment of laughter with locals in LondonStar India batter Virat Kohli was seen having a stroll on the London streets along with his Bollywood actor wife Anushka Sharma. The duo also had a light-hearted conversation with the locals.

Carey enjoying gloveless role for Australia in ODIs with Inglis' riseAlex Carey has seamlessly transitioned from a specialist wicketkeeper to a specialist batter in ODIs, embracing whatever role the team requires. After being Australia's first-choice keeper for nearly five years, Josh Inglis has replaced him.

Criticism will come and go, winning matters: Shardul defends Gautam GambhirIndia coach Gautam Gambhir has faced sharp criticism after recent Test setbacks, but Shardul Thakur has defended him, praising his fighting spirit and influence on the team. With the Asia Cup ahead, Gambhir's leadership remains under the spotlight.

Don't push Bumrah towards early retirement, he's Kohinoor Diamond: Former openerFormer India opener Aakash Chopra has warned against pushing Jasprit Bumrah towards early retirement amid constant criticism of the India fast bowler.

Alyssa Healy, Australia brace for tough spin challenge in Women's World CupAlyssa Healy acknowledged the tough spin-friendly conditions Australia will face at the Women's ODI World Cup. Having returned from injury, Healy is in excellent form, finishing as the top run-scorer in both the T20 and One-Day series against India A.

Khalid Jamil lifts lid on Chhetri snub: Wanted different faces in CAFA CupKhalid Jamil's first India squad raised eyebrows with the omission of Sunil Chhetri, as the new coach prioritises fresh faces for the CAFA Nations Cup, sparking questions about the legendary striker's long-term international future.

Asia Cup 2025: R. Ashwin gives his verdict on Shubman Gill vs Jaiswal debateFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has shared his views on the Shubman Gill vs Yashasvi Jaiswal debate for the upcoming Asia Cup 2025. The two players are in contention to be the backup opener for the continental tournament.

Bangladesh umpire Shathira Jakir Jessy set for historic World Cup stintFormer cricketer Shathira Jakir Jessy will become the first Bangladeshi woman umpire to officiate in a senior World Cup at the Women's ODI World Cup in India. Jessy, who has officiated in various international tournaments, is excited for the opportunity after years of hard work.

I stick to what I believe in: Shoaib Bashir responds to Nathan Lyon's jibeEngland spinner Shoaib Bashir has dismissed Nathan Lyon's critique, insisting he will focus on his own growth ahead of the Ashes. Inspired by Lyon's craft, the 21-year-old aims to recover fully and play a key role in England's bid to reclaim the urn.

Pakistan's T20 team can beat India: Aqib Javed's bold claim for Asia CupSelector Aqib Javed expressed confidence in Pakistan's ability to beat India in the Asia Cup 2025, praising the strength of the current squad. Despite India's dominant T20I record, Pakistan aims to repeat their 2022 Asia Cup success in the upcoming clash on September 14.

Mitchell Johnson slams Cricket Australia CEO's take on lesser Test matchesMitchell Johnson has slammed calls to restrict Test cricket to elite nations, urging the ICC and boards to "stop hoarding the privilege and start sharing the responsibility." He says the format's future lies in support, not exclusion.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
